messages: 06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:00): and you can write good xplat C...

06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:00): it's not that hard

6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:00): even though I'm not too into Java, that's a good part about it, it has all of what I just said, except nativeness
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:00): runtime: why dont you go make a cross platform toolkit then?
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:00): they think their way is better so they do it that way
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:00): smellyhippy: because it shouldnt have to be that way
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:01): smellyhippy: thanks
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:01): yeah, jesus should have made a cross platform toolkit
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:01): hehe there isnt one because it's hard and its alot of effort
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:01): if it was easy and quick there would be alots
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:01): no, really? are you serious? I thought I could make one in 5 minutes...aw dammit
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:01): lol well then why are you wondering why there isnt one? :P
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:01): i wish GNUSTEP would get more attention than it does
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:02): i think the big reason it doesn't get much attention is that it is UGLY
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:02): smellyhippy: I wasnt referring to toolkits, i was referring to a language itself
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:02): GNU is basically made for xplatness
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:03): GNU+Linux == same source running on any processor basically
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:03): runtime: why arn't there languages that are fully cross platform and native?
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:03): i thought c and c++ were farily ubiqious if you stick to the standards
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:03): they are
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:04): you run into endianness issues though
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:04): if ubiqious means what i think it means
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:04): different sizes of integers and whatnot
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:04): but you can't do that much with just the standards, epsecially in terms of GUI
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:04): hoopy: that's why there are std defines for endianess, etc...
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:04): so you are talking about a gui toolkit :p
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:04): hoopy: and so long as your program doesn't depend on those things, it can remain portabel..
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:04): source portable, that is
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:04): what I was talking about

6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:05): was that hopefully one day there will be a lang like C#, easy to use, with a FCL accompanying it, powerful, good performance, with built in GUI libraries (like Winodws Forms) that are native on all platforms
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:06): you'll never get it on *all* platforms I think
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:06): FCL?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:06): Well i was talking about GUI toolkit
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (02:06): maybe all major platforms
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:06): whatever you call it
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (02:06): wow, wikipedia getting hosed by storage
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:06): but after that i switched the subject

06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:06): that's what .net is

06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:07): yeah, java too now... *sigh*
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:07): runtime: what the #(*% do you mean by native
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:07): runtime: you might want to look into GNUSTEP, it's a write-once compile anywhere toolkit
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:07): compiles into native code
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:07): never going to happen
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:07): eh, i shouldn't say that
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:08): GoatCheez: probably, that's why I said "I wish"
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:08): runtime: what's wrong with C++ + <insert toolkit of choice here>
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:08): GoatCheez: Apple's Cocoa is an implementation of OPENSTEP
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:08): there are several major UI libs that are source portable to major platforms
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:08): that's why Cocoa applications are easy to have support both PPC and Intel
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:08): such as GTk or Qt
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:08): vulture: I know that, but what about a class library for certain functions like regex
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:09): runtime: most of the bigger libs try to be all-encompassing, including things like that, so far as I know
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:09): hoopy: JUST c?
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:09): runtime: boost?
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:09): does boost have regex?
1cdb3bef16dddc3dcb4f8dd00d49b10f (02:09): yes
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:09): GoatCheez yes
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:09): then go with C++, Boost, and Qt or Gtk
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:09): problem solved
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:09): GCC doesn't support Obj-C w/ C++ yet, but it will soon
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:10): GoatCheez: but its third party...its not as conveniently integrated into the lang itself as it is in C#
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:11): if you want to get technical, i could say that s.w.f. isnt' integrated into the C# language
29495b0143bc8cd1e02d73dd04fc4de9 (02:11): Question: is something like this possible - http://www.nomorepasting.com/paste.php?pasteID=69641 ?
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:11): i'd say that regex isn't integrated into the C# "language"
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:11): to put it into the language would create another VB6
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:11): it's in the framework it comes with
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (02:11): NO ONE WANTS THAT
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:11): regex is built into ruby
c29e3b0e54ed736f61cb6440b56d79d2 (02:11): there are regex literals in ruby syntax
